ygData.subject: Re: (no subject)
ygData.msgSnippet: Speaking of enchanters, they can be a lot of fun to group with - if you find a fun person playing an enchanter character I highly recommend inviting them to
ygData.messageBody:
Speaking of enchanters, they can be a lot of fun to group with - if you find
a fun person playing an enchanter character I highly recommend inviting them
to group. I have discovered that enchanters are one of those classes often
mistakenly overlooked by groups.

- Faras the aspiring drunken bard who just learned to bellow last night ;-)

> -----Original Message-----
> From: jay schultze [mailto:sartori69@...]
> Sent: Thursday, May 27, 1999 10:56 AM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Disenchantment.
>
>
> From: "jay schultze" <sartori69@...>
>
> >I wish the spellshield effect of guardian rhythms were really
> >there. I got to watch with a bit of jealousy last night as
> >someone fought a monster and I kept seeing "A [monster] hits
> >[person] but a magical skin(?) absorbs the blow."
> >
> >--
> >John H. Kim
> >kim@...
> >
>
> All the mage classes have a line of spells starting with
> Shieldskin (wizards
> get it at 16th). It costs a spell component. Unfortunately,
> it is for the
> self only and will absorb up to a certain amount of damage.
> Later on they
> get Leatherskin, and later an even better one.
> Now the cool thing about Enchanters is they have a similar
> spell that they
> CAN cast on others, and it is very effective. It also gives
> the same message
> that your magical skin absorbs the blow.
>
> Sartori D'Elsiraad
> Bard of Kelethin of the 11th Chorus
> Veeshan
